005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Num;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.Pair;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.system.Discretization;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalIntegration;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalJacobian;
016import java.util.function.BiFunction;
017import org.ejml.dense.row.decomposition.qr.QRDecompositionHouseholder_DDRM;
018import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
019
020/**
021 * A Kalman filter combines predictions from a model and measurements to give an estimate of the
022 * true system state. This is useful because many states cannot be measured directly as a result of
023 * sensor noise, or because the state is "hidden".
024 *
025 * <p>Kalman filters use a K gain matrix to determine whether to trust the model or measurements
026 * more. Kalman filter theory uses statistics to compute an optimal K gain which minimizes the sum
027 * of squares error in the state estimate. This K gain is used to correct the state estimate by some
028 * amount of the difference between the actual measurements and the measurements predicted by the
029 * model.
030 *
031 * <p>An unscented Kalman filter uses nonlinear state and measurement models. It propagates the
032 * error covariance using sigma points chosen to approximate the true probability distribution.
033 *
034 * <p>For more on the underlying math, read
035 * https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf chapter 9 "Stochastic control
036 * theory".
037 *
038 * <p>This class implements a square-root-form unscented Kalman filter (SR-UKF). For more
039 * information about the SR-UKF, see https://www.researchgate.net/publication/3908304.
040 */
041@SuppressWarnings({"MemberName", "ClassTypeParameterName"})
042public class UnscentedKalmanFilter<States extends Num, Inputs extends Num, Outputs extends Num>
043    implements KalmanTypeFilter<States, Inputs, Outputs> {
044  private final Nat<States> m_states;
045  private final Nat<Outputs> m_outputs;
046
047  private final BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_f;
048  private final BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_h;
049
050  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_meanFuncX;
051  private BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_meanFuncY;
052  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_residualFuncX;
053  private BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_residualFuncY;
054  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_addFuncX;
055
056  private Matrix<States, N1> m_xHat;
057  private Matrix<States, States> m_S;
058  private final Matrix<States, States> m_contQ;
059  private final Matrix<Outputs, Outputs> m_contR;
060  private Matrix<States, ?> m_sigmasF;
061  private double m_dtSeconds;
062
063  private final MerweScaledSigmaPoints<States> m_pts;
064
065  /**
066   * Constructs an Unscented Kalman Filter.
067   *
068   * @param states A Nat representing the number of states.
069   * @param outputs A Nat representing the number of outputs.
070   * @param f A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the derivative of the state vector.
071   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
072   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states.
073   * @param measurementStdDevs Standard deviations of measurements.
074   * @param nominalDtSeconds Nominal discretization timestep.
075   */
076  @SuppressWarnings("LambdaParameterName")
077  public UnscentedKalmanFilter(
078      Nat<States> states,
079      Nat<Outputs> outputs,
080      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> f,
081      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> h,
082      Matrix<States, N1> stateStdDevs,
083      Matrix<Outputs, N1> measurementStdDevs,
084      double nominalDtSeconds) {
085    this(
086        states,
087        outputs,
088        f,
089        h,
090        stateStdDevs,
091        measurementStdDevs,
092        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm)),
093        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm)),
094        Matrix::minus,
095        Matrix::minus,
096        Matrix::plus,
097        nominalDtSeconds);
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Constructs an unscented Kalman filter with custom mean, residual, and addition functions. Using
102   * custom functions for arithmetic can be useful if you have angles in the state or measurements,
103   * because they allow you to correctly account for the modular nature of angle arithmetic.
104   *
105   * @param states A Nat representing the number of states.
106   * @param outputs A Nat representing the number of outputs.
107   * @param f A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the derivative of the state vector.
108   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
109   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states.
110   * @param measurementStdDevs Standard deviations of measurements.
111   * @param meanFuncX A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 state vectors using a
112   *     given set of weights.
113   * @param meanFuncY A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 measurement vectors using
114   *     a given set of weights.
115   * @param residualFuncX A function that computes the residual of two state vectors (i.e. it
116   *     subtracts them.)
117   * @param residualFuncY A function that computes the residual of two measurement vectors (i.e. it
118   *     subtracts them.)
119   * @param addFuncX A function that adds two state vectors.
120   * @param nominalDtSeconds Nominal discretization timestep.
121   */
122  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
123  public UnscentedKalmanFilter(
124      Nat<States> states,
125      Nat<Outputs> outputs,
126      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> f,
127      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> h,
128      Matrix<States, N1> stateStdDevs,
129      Matrix<Outputs, N1> measurementStdDevs,
130      BiFunction<Matrix<States, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> meanFuncX,
131      BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> meanFuncY,
132      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX,
133      BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> residualFuncY,
134      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX,
135      double nominalDtSeconds) {
136    this.m_states = states;
137    this.m_outputs = outputs;
138
139    m_f = f;
140    m_h = h;
141
142    m_meanFuncX = meanFuncX;
143    m_meanFuncY = meanFuncY;
144    m_residualFuncX = residualFuncX;
145    m_residualFuncY = residualFuncY;
146    m_addFuncX = addFuncX;
147
148    m_dtSeconds = nominalDtSeconds;
149
150    m_contQ = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(states, stateStdDevs);
151    m_contR = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(outputs, measurementStdDevs);
152
153    m_pts = new MerweScaledSigmaPoints<>(states);
154
155    reset();
156  }
157
158  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
159  static <S extends Num, C extends Num>
160      Pair<Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, C>> squareRootUnscentedTransform(
161          Nat<S> s,
162          Nat<C> dim,
163          Matrix<C, ?> sigmas,
164          Matrix<?, N1> Wm,
165          Matrix<?, N1> Wc,
166          BiFunction<Matrix<C, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>> meanFunc,
167          BiFunction<Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>> residualFunc,
168          Matrix<C, C> squareRootR) {
169    if (sigmas.getNumRows() != dim.getNum() || sigmas.getNumCols() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1) {
170      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
171          "Sigmas must be covDim by 2 * states + 1! Got "
172              + sigmas.getNumRows()
173              + " by "
174              + sigmas.getNumCols());
175    }
176
177    if (Wm.getNumRows() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1 || Wm.getNumCols() != 1) {
178      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
179          "Wm must be 2 * states + 1 by 1! Got " + Wm.getNumRows() + " by " + Wm.getNumCols());
180    }
181
182    if (Wc.getNumRows() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1 || Wc.getNumCols() != 1) {
183      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
184          "Wc must be 2 * states + 1 by 1! Got " + Wc.getNumRows() + " by " + Wc.getNumCols());
185    }
186
187    // New mean is usually just the sum of the sigmas * weight:
188    //       n
189    // dot = Σ W[k] Xᵢ[k]
190    //      k=1
191    Matrix<C, N1> x = meanFunc.apply(sigmas, Wm);
192
193    Matrix<C, ?> Sbar = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(dim.getNum(), 2 * s.getNum() + dim.getNum()));
194    for (int i = 0; i < 2 * s.getNum(); i++) {
195      Sbar.setColumn(
196          i,
197          residualFunc.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(1 + i), x).times(Math.sqrt(Wc.get(1, 0))));
198    }
199    Sbar.assignBlock(0, 2 * s.getNum(), squareRootR);
200
201    QRDecompositionHouseholder_DDRM qr = new QRDecompositionHouseholder_DDRM();
202    var qrStorage = Sbar.transpose().getStorage();
203
204    if (!qr.decompose(qrStorage.getDDRM())) {
205      throw new RuntimeException("QR decomposition failed! Input matrix:\n" + qrStorage.toString());
206    }
207
208    Matrix<C, C> newS = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(qr.getR(null, true)));
209    newS.rankUpdate(residualFunc.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(0), x), Wc.get(0, 0), false);
210
211    return new Pair<>(x, newS);
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Returns the square-root error covariance matrix S.
216   *
217   * @return the square-root error covariance matrix S.
218   */
219  public Matrix<States, States> getS() {
220    return m_S;
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Returns an element of the square-root error covariance matrix S.
225   *
226   * @param row Row of S.
227   * @param col Column of S.
228   * @return the value of the square-root error covariance matrix S at (i, j).
229   */
230  public double getS(int row, int col) {
231    return m_S.get(row, col);
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Sets the entire square-root error covariance matrix S.
236   *
237   * @param newS The new value of S to use.
238   */
239  public void setS(Matrix<States, States> newS) {
240    m_S = newS;
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Returns the reconstructed error covariance matrix P.
245   *
246   * @return the error covariance matrix P.
247   */
248  @Override
249  public Matrix<States, States> getP() {
250    return m_S.transpose().times(m_S);
251  }
252
253  /**
254   * Returns an element of the error covariance matrix P.
255   *
256   * @param row Row of P.
257   * @param col Column of P.
258   * @return the value of the error covariance matrix P at (i, j).
259   * @throws UnsupportedOperationException indexing into the reconstructed P matrix is not supported
260   */
261  @Override
262  public double getP(int row, int col) {
263    throw new UnsupportedOperationException(
264        "indexing into the reconstructed P matrix is not supported");
265  }
266
267  /**
268   * Sets the entire error covariance matrix P.
269   *
270   * @param newP The new value of P to use.
271   */
272  @Override
273  public void setP(Matrix<States, States> newP) {
274    m_S = newP.lltDecompose(false);
275  }
276
277  /**
278   * Returns the state estimate x-hat.
279   *
280   * @return the state estimate x-hat.
281   */
282  @Override
283  public Matrix<States, N1> getXhat() {
284    return m_xHat;
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * Returns an element of the state estimate x-hat.
289   *
290   * @param row Row of x-hat.
291   * @return the value of the state estimate x-hat at i.
292   */
293  @Override
294  public double getXhat(int row) {
295    return m_xHat.get(row, 0);
296  }
297
298  /**
299   * Set initial state estimate x-hat.
300   *
301   * @param xHat The state estimate x-hat.
302   */
303  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
304  @Override
305  public void setXhat(Matrix<States, N1> xHat) {
306    m_xHat = xHat;
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * Set an element of the initial state estimate x-hat.
311   *
312   * @param row Row of x-hat.
313   * @param value Value for element of x-hat.
314   */
315  @Override
316  public void setXhat(int row, double value) {
317    m_xHat.set(row, 0, value);
318  }
319
320  /** Resets the observer. */
321  @Override
322  public void reset() {
323    m_xHat = new Matrix<>(m_states, Nat.N1());
324    m_S = new Matrix<>(m_states, m_states);
325    m_sigmasF = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(m_states.getNum(), 2 * m_states.getNum() + 1));
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Project the model into the future with a new control input u.
330   *
331   * @param u New control input from controller.
332   * @param dtSeconds Timestep for prediction.
333   */
334  @SuppressWarnings({"LocalVariableName", "ParameterName"})
335  @Override
336  public void predict(Matrix<Inputs, N1> u, double dtSeconds) {
337    // Discretize Q before projecting mean and covariance forward
338    Matrix<States, States> contA =
339        NumericalJacobian.numericalJacobianX(m_states, m_states, m_f, m_xHat, u);
340    var discQ = Discretization.discretizeAQTaylor(contA, m_contQ, dtSeconds).getSecond();
341    var squareRootDiscQ = discQ.lltDecompose(true);
342
343    var sigmas = m_pts.squareRootSigmaPoints(m_xHat, m_S);
344
345    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); ++i) {
346      Matrix<States, N1> x = sigmas.extractColumnVector(i);
347
348      m_sigmasF.setColumn(i, NumericalIntegration.rk4(m_f, x, u, dtSeconds));
349    }
350
351    var ret =
352        squareRootUnscentedTransform(
353            m_states,
354            m_states,
355            m_sigmasF,
356            m_pts.getWm(),
357            m_pts.getWc(),
358            m_meanFuncX,
359            m_residualFuncX,
360            squareRootDiscQ);
361
362    m_xHat = ret.getFirst();
363    m_S = ret.getSecond();
364    m_dtSeconds = dtSeconds;
365  }
366
367  /**
368   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
369   *
370   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
371   * @param y Measurement vector.
372   */
373  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
374  @Override
375  public void correct(Matrix<Inputs, N1> u, Matrix<Outputs, N1> y) {
376    correct(
377        m_outputs, u, y, m_h, m_contR, m_meanFuncY, m_residualFuncY, m_residualFuncX, m_addFuncX);
378  }
379
380  /**
381   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
382   *
383   * <p>This is useful for when the measurements available during a timestep's Correct() call vary.
384   * The h(x, u) passed to the constructor is used if one is not provided (the two-argument version
385   * of this function).
386   *
387   * @param <R> Number of measurements in y.
388   * @param rows Number of rows in y.
389   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
390   * @param y Measurement vector.
391   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
392   * @param R Measurement noise covariance matrix (continuous-time).
393   */
394  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LambdaParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
395  public <R extends Num> void correct(
396      Nat<R> rows,
397      Matrix<Inputs, N1> u,
398      Matrix<R, N1> y,
399      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> h,
400      Matrix<R, R> R) {
401    BiFunction<Matrix<R, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> meanFuncY =
402        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm));
403    BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX =
404        Matrix::minus;
405    BiFunction<Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> residualFuncY = Matrix::minus;
406    BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX = Matrix::plus;
407    correct(rows, u, y, h, R, meanFuncY, residualFuncY, residualFuncX, addFuncX);
408  }
409
410  /**
411   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
412   *
413   * <p>This is useful for when the measurements available during a timestep's Correct() call vary.
414   * The h(x, u) passed to the constructor is used if one is not provided (the two-argument version
415   * of this function).
416   *
417   * @param <R> Number of measurements in y.
418   * @param rows Number of rows in y.
419   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
420   * @param y Measurement vector.
421   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
422   * @param R Measurement noise covariance matrix (continuous-time).
423   * @param meanFuncY A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 measurement vectors using
424   *     a given set of weights.
425   * @param residualFuncY A function that computes the residual of two measurement vectors (i.e. it
426   *     subtracts them.)
427   * @param residualFuncX A function that computes the residual of two state vectors (i.e. it
428   *     subtracts them.)
429   * @param addFuncX A function that adds two state vectors.
430   */
431  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
432  public <R extends Num> void correct(
433      Nat<R> rows,
434      Matrix<Inputs, N1> u,
435      Matrix<R, N1> y,
436      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> h,
437      Matrix<R, R> R,
438      BiFunction<Matrix<R, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> meanFuncY,
439      BiFunction<Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> residualFuncY,
440      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX,
441      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX) {
442    final var discR = Discretization.discretizeR(R, m_dtSeconds);
443    final var squareRootDiscR = discR.lltDecompose(true);
444
445    // Transform sigma points into measurement space
446    Matrix<R, ?> sigmasH = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(rows.getNum(), 2 * m_states.getNum() + 1));
447    var sigmas = m_pts.squareRootSigmaPoints(m_xHat, m_S);
448    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); i++) {
449      Matrix<R, N1> hRet = h.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(i), u);
450      sigmasH.setColumn(i, hRet);
451    }
452
453    // Mean and covariance of prediction passed through unscented transform
454    var transRet =
455        squareRootUnscentedTransform(
456            m_states,
457            rows,
458            sigmasH,
459            m_pts.getWm(),
460            m_pts.getWc(),
461            meanFuncY,
462            residualFuncY,
463            squareRootDiscR);
464    var yHat = transRet.getFirst();
465    var Sy = transRet.getSecond();
466
467    // Compute cross covariance of the state and the measurements
468    Matrix<States, R> Pxy = new Matrix<>(m_states, rows);
469    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); i++) {
470      // Pxy += (sigmas_f[:, i] - x̂)(sigmas_h[:, i] - ŷ)ᵀ W_c[i]
471      var dx = residualFuncX.apply(m_sigmasF.extractColumnVector(i), m_xHat);
472      var dy = residualFuncY.apply(sigmasH.extractColumnVector(i), yHat).transpose();
473
474      Pxy = Pxy.plus(dx.times(dy).times(m_pts.getWc(i)));
475    }
476
477    // K = (P_{xy} / S_yᵀ) / S_y
478    // K = (S_y \ P_{xy}ᵀ)ᵀ / S_y
479    // K = (S_yᵀ \ (S_y \ P_{xy}ᵀ))ᵀ
480    Matrix<States, R> K =
481        Sy.transpose()
482            .solveFullPivHouseholderQr(Sy.solveFullPivHouseholderQr(Pxy.transpose()))
483            .transpose();
484
485    // x̂ₖ₊₁⁺ = x̂ₖ₊₁⁻ + K(y − ŷ)
486    m_xHat = addFuncX.apply(m_xHat, K.times(residualFuncY.apply(y, yHat)));
487
488    Matrix<States, R> U = K.times(Sy);
489    for (int i = 0; i < rows.getNum(); i++) {
490      m_S.rankUpdate(U.extractColumnVector(i), -1, false);
491    }
492  }
493}
